intro: Atractylis delicatula, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by cylindrical, bract-like fruits. Atractylis delicatula is a low-growing perennial that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
